WRITING.TITLE: So confused as to what my activity level is. Could somebody help me?
WRITING.TEXT:
I'm 5' 8" 132lbs and I'm really confused as to what my Activity level is, I feel like I can't get an accurate read. I'm a student so I walk around for a decent part of the day. But after school I participate in a 4-5 day a week, 2 1/2 hour long swim practice and every other day I lift. On the weekends I'll typically go run about 2.5 miles a day. I'm really confused as to what this makes my activity level and overall TDEE, any help would be much appreciated!
EDIT: I forgot a pretty major price of info, after getting one of my yearly physicals, my doctor has me on weekly weigh ins and won't allow me to lose any more weight. So I'm really looking to find my maintenance caloric intake without losing any drastic amounts of weight.

WRITING.TITLE: Request For My Unpearling- Chaseair115/Chaseair
WRITING.TEXT: So I was, regrettably, part of the Recharge attack on the server. And while I realize that I may have done something that is overall pretty bad, I believe that in the 8(?) months that I've been pearled, I have matured greatly and actually want to participate in the server as a productive member. What I want to experience, I've been caught up with the people who have surrounded me for a long, long time on HCF. And I joined Recharge for their raid because, well, all of my friends are doing it. Now don't get me wrong I enjoy pvp but I also appreciate what this server does. And I also want to utilize something that I really don't utilize often in pvp, intelligence, and quick thinking. That's why I think I want a second chance. Just to experience this awesome social experiment that is civcraft. So if you guys could give me a shot at being unpearled, I would be more than happy to pay of debts and claims. Thanks!
Miss you matty
Hey, you matter dude. Keep your head up, we care about you.

WRITING.TITLE: Need some help with loading Windows 7 on a newly built PC.
WRITING.TEXT:
So I built my PC and all I have left is to download Windows, so I used BootCamp Assistant to create the USB drive and plugged it into my computers USB 2.0 slot. And when I do that and load up the BIOS, (I made sure that the USB was at the front of the boot order) it still boots with just a blinking underscore and doesn't go any further than that. And when I remove the USB and plug it into another slot I get "Reboot and Select proper Boot Device or insert Boot Media in selected Boot device and press a key." After reinserting the USB and pressing a key it goes back to the blinking cursor. Any help would be greatly appreciated!
I have an MSI 970A-G43 ATX AM3+ Motherboard but I'm not sure if it's an issue with the motherboard or USB or the ISO.
EDIT: Fixed, thanks guy :D

WRITING.TITLE: Could use some computer help, thanks!
WRITING.TEXT: So I built my PC and all I have left is to download Windows, so I used BootCamp Assistant to create the USB drive and plugged it into my computers USB 2.0 slot. And when I do that and load up the BIOS, (I made sure that the USB was at the front of the boot order) it still boots with just a blinking underscore and doesn't go any further than that. WRITING.TITLE: [Troubleshooting] Windows 7 won't boot from USB
WRITING.TEXT:
So I built my PC and all I have left is to download Windows, so I used BootCamp Assistant to create the USB drive and plugged it into my computers USB 2.0 slot. And when I do that and load up the BIOS, (I made sure that the USB was at the front of the boot order) it still boots with just a blinking underscore and doesn't go any further than that. And when I remove the USB and plug it into another slot I get "Reboot and Select proper Boot Device or insert Boot Media in selected Boot device and press a key." After reinserting the USB and pressing a key it goes back to the blinking cursor. Any help would be greatly appreciated!
EDIT: Fixed, Thanks Guys :D
